titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Boswell Collection Supplement
titlestmt.author: by Diane J. Ducharme

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 06:01
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists mainly of letters and writings by or pertaining to various members of the Boswell of Auchinleck family. Series III includes seventeen journals of weather conditions and work assignments on the Auchinleck estate.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ongoing collection of documents acquired by gift and purchase from various sources. Type of accession (gift or purchase) and date of acquisition is noted in the box-and-folder list. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Boswell Collection Supplement is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Boswell Collection Supplement. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This finding aid is updated periodically to account for new materials that have been added to the collection. The date of the most recent update is noted on the title page. For information on material that may have been acquired for the collection since the last update, please consult the Public Service Desk.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: For more extensive holdings of Boswell family material, including the papers of James Boswell, see GEN MSS 89, Boswell Collection, and GEN MSS 150, Boswell Collection Addition.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This finding aid encompasses accessions of single manuscripts and small groups of manuscripts and other papers, by or pertaining to the Boswell of Auchinleck family, which the library has chosen to group and list as an artificial collection. Materials incorporated into the collection prior to January 1995 have been organized into Series I, Letters, and Series II, Writings. Materials added to the collection since that time are located in Series II, Additions since July 1995, listed in the order in which they were added.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 4 ALS to Mrs. Osbourne, with whom Euphemia seems to have boarded, mentioning her illness and her financial difficulties.
With: 2 typescripts carbon of "Ballad, Written in 1817, by Euphemia Boswell..."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: ALS to David Robertson of Spottiswoode & Robertson, asking that he find lodgings for Euphemia Boswell.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Manuscript signed "Alex. Boswell" in unidentified hand.

did.unittitle: Journals for the estate of Auchinleck

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The journals record the daily weather, including barometer readings for some years, and details of work done by tradesmen and laborers on the estate.
In blue paper wrappers

did.unittitle: Journals for the estate of Auchinleck

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The journals record the daily weather, including barometer readings for some years. Those for 1784-86 also give details of work done by tradesmen and laborers on the estate.
In blue paper wrappers.
